results.title: At This Brewery, Blessings Are as Important as Barley and Hops
results.abstract: At Mount Saint Bernard Abbey, the monks help make Britain’s only Trappist beer, a full-bodied brew that has won fans since its launch five years ago.

results.title: Milan Kundera, Literary Star Who Skewered Communist Rule, Dies at 94
results.abstract: The author of “The Unbearable Lightness of Being,” he was known for sexually charged novels that captured the suffocating absurdity of life in his native Czechoslovakia.

media.caption: Milan Kundera in 1984, when his novel “The Unbearable Lightness of Being” became an instant success and later the basis of a movie.

results.byline: By Alan Feuer and Jeremy W. Peters
results.title: Arizona Man Cited in Conspiracy Theories Sues Fox News for Defamation
results.abstract: Ray Epps, a two-time Trump voter, says Tucker Carlson repeatedly and falsely named him as a covert government agent who incited the Jan. 6 attack.

media.caption: After the repeated unsubstantiated on-air accusations by Tucker Carlson, Ray Epps and his wife, Robyn, received numerous death threats and were forced to sell their home and business and move out of Arizona.

results.title: Coronavirus Probably Spread Widely in Deer and Perhaps Back to People, U.S.D.A. Says
results.abstract: From late 2021 to early 2022, humans transmitted the coronavirus to white-tailed deer more than 100 times, research suggests.
org_facet: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service

media.caption: Scientists collected more than 11,000 samples from deer in 26 states and Washington, D.C. They found that one-third had antibodies to the coronavirus and 12 percent were actively infected.
media.copyright: Genna Martin/San Francisco Chronicle, via Associated Press
